He always thought of the sea as 'la mar' which is what people call her in Spanish when they love her. Sometimes those who love her say bad things of her but they are always said as though she were a woman. Some of the younger fishermen
column2: those who used buoys as floats for their lines and had motorboats
column3: bought when the shark livers had brought much money
column4: spoke of her as 'el mar' which is masculine.They spoke of her as a contestant or a place or even an enemy. But the old man always thought of her as feminine and as something that gave or withheld great favours
column5: and if she did wild or wicked things it was because she could not help them. The moon affects her as it does a woman
column7: The Old Man and the Sea
